text: It is difficult for many to see Mr. Pearson in the role of a orator at the hustings, the spellbinder that Mr. Diefenbaker was in the last two campaigns. The impression remains that the Liberal leader is still the diplomatist, more at home in the chancery, or the corridors of the United Nations, not the father figure, so necessary in Canadian leadership, or the practical politician, able to talk about sewage problems in Algoma East.
